Show:

JXG.Turtle Class

Defined in: src/base/turtle.js:60
Module: JXG

Constructs a new Turtle object.

It is derived from JXG.GeometryElement. It stores all properties required to move a turtle.

Constructor

JXG.Turtle

(
  • board
  • parents
  • attributes
)

Defined in src/base/turtle.js:60

Parameters:

  • board JXG.Board

    The board the new turtle is drawn on.

  • parents Array

    Start position and start direction of the turtle. Possible values are

    • [x, y, angle]
    • [[x, y], angle]
    • [x, y]
    • [[x, y]]
  • attributes Object

    Attributes to change the visual properties of the turtle object All angles are in degrees.

  • Index
  • Methods
  • Properties

evalAt

(
  • t
  • co.
)
Number

Defined in src/base/turtle.js:780

The co-coordinate of the turtle curve at position t is returned.

Parameters:

  • t Number

    parameter

  • co. String

    Either 'X' or 'Y'.

Returns:

Number:

x/y-coordinate of turtle at position t or x/y-coordinate of the turtle position if t > position.

Boolean

Defined in src/base/turtle.js:877

Checks whether (x,y) is near the curve.

  • y Number

Returns:

Boolean:

lookTo

(
  • target
)
JXG.Turtle chainable

Defined in src/base/turtle.js:631

Rotates the turtle into a new direction. There are two possibilities:

Parameters:

  • target Number | Array

    If a number is given, it is interpreted as the new direction to look to; If an array consisting of two Numbers is given targeted is used as a pair coordinates.

Returns:

JXG.Turtle:

pointer to the turtle object

(
  • t
)
Number

Defined in src/base/turtle.js:807

If t is not supplied the x-coordinate of the turtle is returned. Otherwise the x-coordinate of the turtle curve at position t is returned.

Parameters:

  • t Number

    parameter

Returns:

Number:

x-coordinate of the turtle position or x-coordinate of turtle at position t
